column5: NO NO NO  Like Wayne said,smell your fish.LOL  Cucumber scent fills your hub,it,s a whitie.

when in doubt  herring smile whitefish pout  so when in doubt check it out        Ø  Season: Jan 1-March 15th and 2nd Sat in May-Sept 30th Ø  Limit: Sport Fishing Licence: 2, Conservation Licence: 1 Ø  The above seasons and limits are identical to two other popular coldwater species in the lake – Lake Whitefish and Lake Trout. Ø  The new season and limits can be seen on page 81 (bottom right in red) of the newly released 2015 Recreational Fishing Regulations Summary.  www.ontario.ca/fishing Ø  For management purposes Lake Simcoe includes Lake Couchiching and tributaries as identified on page 81 as above. Ø  On page 10  it lists cisco (lake herring) along with baitfish species which have a licenced angler limit of 120 for personal possession. This applies in most other areas of the province, but NOT on Lake Simcoe where the total possession limit of cisco is 2 (Sport Licence) and 1 (Conservation). Nicely Done!  Pretty well captures it Terry.  They don't pay you enuff-  Hope to see you @ The Fishing For Tyler gig in 2015  Merry Christmas to All here and Good Health-Prosperity and Tight Lines  Paul

I brought home a  19" Lake Herring the year Terry, Andy and I sledded out from my place onto GBay. Filleted, battered and deep fried like any other fish... and it tasted no different than a pickerel or pike done the same way.

Nicely Done!  Pretty well captures it Terry.  They don't pay you enuff-  Hope to see you @ The Fishing For Tyler gig in 2015  Merry Christmas to All here and Good Health-Prosperity and Tight Lines  Paul  Ya,he pretty good at cut and paste Paul. LOL  Nice to hear from you and hope to see you there as well.

Ya,he pretty good at cut and paste Paul. LOL  Nice to hear from you and hope to see you there as well.  For Sure Brian B.--been off hook lately--had a wee cyber chat with The French Fries about a month ago--looks like a go?  Take Care Man  Paul  Noted: cut and "accurate" paste artist though --it's appreciated
hey hey hey   this part was all me  when in doubt  herring smile whitefish pout  so when in doubt check it out    the rest was cut and paste     glad we cleared that up   lol
Are they putting a size limit on them?? 11-14 inches are the only ones good for eating. Kinda like perch.
no
I have a hot smoker, cold smoker and a really good recipe for pickeled herring. Soooooooooo if any one wants to supply some, I'll do the hard part, you get half, I get half
Is it worth pickling or smoking 2 herring being the possession limit is 2 .
Sure it's worth it.
home sunday afternoon ? Drop some specks off if  i get back at a decent time
Looking forward to it!
Heard there opening herring so really any recipes on pickling out there. I know a neighbour that has a cold smoker coukd try that as well
2 fish limit,  is it worth pickling  2 ?
pike bait  how big do they get on simcoe?
Going to be a gong show out there this year (If we get any ice)
Yup, although I always found Simcoe to be a gong show.
I can picture it now...all the guys playing dumb keeping too many whities, claiming they thought were Cisco.

pike bait  how big do they get on simcoe? Most of the ones I get perch fishing are between 10-14 inches. Very annoying some days. You can't even get your bait through them to get to the perch on the bottom
Is this for real?
Yeah bout the same size here. For some reason I thought they got bigger on Simcoe
Is this for real?  Yes.
Good news for the simcoe guys though.  I'll have to try pickling a fish or two this winter
I see. Thats probably where I heard about the monsters lol.
I heard that this was being considered buy the MNR but I couldn't find any official report that cisco season will reopen at any time specifically.  Does anyone have anything official?
yeah hard copy 2015 regs are out
yeah hard copy 2015 regs are out  Yup, right on the cover no?
Going to be a gong show out there this year (If we get any ice)  I have inside information......no ice this year!!!
I have inside information......no ice this year!!!  You're getting coal in your stocking!  lol!
walking skidooing atv or boat  we will be fishing for them on simcoe in the new year
I really wouldn't be upset and not being able to fish them through the ice, the boat is ready to go anytime
I am interested in trying a Simcoe herring.  I've had Nippising herring before, but wasn't a big fan.  The ones on Simcoe are long and skinny compared to the fatties on Nip.
They should leave them closed. They will get abused/overharvested whatever.. However, it might be a good way for the MNR to make extra $$$$.

Thanks Terry.  That's why I couldn't find anything online yet.  Without knowing the limits and such until I get a hardcopy in my hands, at first blush, I think it's great news.  If the science says a harvest is ok now, then I'm all for it.  I remember back in the day, having a couple of Cisco mixed in with a cooler of perch to take home, clean(  arghhh ), and enjoy.  Nice to have those days back.

They should leave them closed. They will get abused/overharvested whatever.. However, it might be a good way for the MNR to make extra $$$$.   Over harvested?  2 LIMIT SPORT AND 1 LIMIT CON.  I think the biggest charges that will come from people not knowing the dif. Then again we will hear,didnt know the dif.

I remember they were considering an aggregate limit.  In other words:  2 whitefish..   or 2 herring..   or 1 whitefish and 1 herring.   This would eliminate the confusion between the two.  I'm guessing that's not the case?  Gotta get me a hardcopy of the regs!!!!!!!!
